body:
Problem:  Unable to predict which byte-offset to place virtual text to
          make it repeat visually in the wrapped part of a line.
Solution: Add a flag to `nvim_buf_set_extmark()` that causes virtual
          text to repeat in wrapped lines.

Close #23108

comment_data.body:
`ui_watched` extmarks should not repeat
```suggestion
    if (!vt || !(vt->flags & kVTBreakRepeat)) {
```
The `item->kind == kDecorKindUIWatched` condition is always false here because `vt` is always `NULL` in that case.
win_col overrides `virt_text_pos` so I'd suggest removing the latter for clarity.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2094,6 +2094,32 @@ describe('extmark decorations', function()
                                                         |
     ]]}
   end)
+
+  it('virt_text_repeat_linebreak repeats virtual text on wrapped lines', function()
+    screen:try_resize(40, 5)
+    meths.set_option_value('breakindent', true, {})
+    insert(example_text)
+    meths.buf_set_extmark(0, ns, 1, 0, { virt_text = {{'│', 'NonText'}}, virt_text_pos = 'overlay', virt_text_repeat_linebreak = true })
+    meths.buf_set_extmark(0, ns, 1, 3, { virt_text = {{'│', 'NonText'}}, virt_text_pos = 'overlay', virt_text_repeat_linebreak = true })
+    command('norm gg')
+    screen:expect{grid=[[
+      ^for _,item in ipairs(items) do          |
+      {1:│}  {1:│}local text, hl_id_cell, count = unpa|
+      {1:│}  {1:│}ck(item)                            |
+          if hl_id_cell ~= nil then           |
+                                              |
+    ]]}
+    meths.buf_clear_namespace(0, ns, 0, -1)
+    meths.buf_set_extmark(0, ns, 1, 0, { virt_text = {{'│', 'NonText'}}, virt_text_pos = 'overlay', virt_text_repeat_linebreak = true, virt_text_win_col = 0 })

comment_data.body: The last condition is again never reached because `vt` is only assigned when `item->kind == kDecorKindVirtText`, so PVS will probably give a warning here.

comment_regular_data.body: Let me know if this property makes sense and I'll update news.txt/failing tests.

I agree this is a useful feature. Not sure about the name, I'd like "line" to be part of it somehow (what is being broken?), also verb-subject sounds more natural to me like `virt_text_repeat_linebreak` although that part might be more subjective.

I expect this also works with `win_col` specified position? Would be good with a test also for that.

I'm not sure about the name either. "Break" is established terminology for wrapped lines with `'breakindent[opt]'`. `virt_text_repeat_linebreak` is fine with me.

> I expect this also works with win_col specified position? Would be good with a test also for that.

Yeah I had written a test for it earlier, I think it worked. I'll add it later.
option names are all over the place tho, there is both 'linebreak', 'wrap' and yes 'breakindent'.

I think we need to "deactivate" the virtual text on the last row of a line, I'm seeing the virtual text repeated on a line it doesn't belong. Though for some reason it only happens with 'relativenumber' enabled, when quickly moving the cursor up/down, and quickly disappears again. Need to figure out the right condition and device a test.
